intro: Petalostylis labicheoides var. microphylla, commonly known as the small-leaved labichea, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its small, delicate leaves. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, typically appearing in late winter to early spring. It is often found in sandy or rocky soils in arid or semi-arid regions. Due to its unique morphology and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
